There was definitely not any sort of "Bakufu renunciation of firearms".  Th=
at's a myth that we tackled in a prior podcast in fact:

http://samuraiarch=
ives.podbean.com/2011/05/29/ep05-the-myth-of-samurai-giving-up-the-gun/

Mo=
st han had gunnery instructors, villages were licensed to use firearms to s=
care off or kill threatening animals, and guns were a necessity in various =
locations due to intrusions from Russians in the far North and defense of p=
orts in the South.  To put it simply - there were no active wars, so techno=
logical advancement of guns in Japan wasn't necessary, but guns weren't thr=
own away.  The book "Giving Up the Gun" by Perrin is a joke, and has been r=
idiculed and lambasted in the Western and Japanese scholarship for decades,=
 but his book is still around because non-Japanese history experts still qu=
ote it.
